Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(5) What is API Design?

  • Definition
  • Rationale
  • Guide
  • Reference


Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(6) First, Why Design APIs?

  • Every API starts with a story
    • "We need ..."
    • "Our customers want ..."
    • "I have an idea ..."
  • Designing is critical to success


Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(7) What is API Design : Definition

  • Creating a design sets boundaries
  • Establishes target audience
  • Identifies measures of success


Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(8) What is API Design : Rationale

  • Creates a reason for this API
  • Shows the set of actions
  • Details results


Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(9) What is API Design : Guide

  • Offers hints for properites and resources
  • Helps programmers say 'yes' or 'no'
  • Encourages paying attention to measures


Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(10) What is API Design : Reference

  • Provides examples for API users
  • Responds to common challenges
  • Invites alternate uses


Design Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(11) What is API Design : Summary

  • Defines your API
  • Gives meaning/purpose to your work
  • Acts as a guide while building
  • Provides a reference for users

API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(13) API Stories

  • Design process guidance
  • Shared understanding (across teams)
  • Structured MD document


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(14) API Story Example



API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(15) API Story Elements

  • Purpose
    • Simple statement
  • Properties
    • All the data points (storage and queries)
  • Resources
    • RESTful states (home, list, item, etc.)
  • Actions
    • list, read, write, update, delete, share, etc.
  • Rules
    • limits, validators, etc.


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(16) API Story : Purpose

  • Simple statement
  • Shareable
  • Repeatable
  • Sets scope and audience


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(17) API Story : Purpose : Example



API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(18) API Story : Properties

  • Data points for the API
  • Includes storage and query properties
  • Provides clear list and definition
  • Chance to reuse shared properties


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(19) API Story : Properties : Example



API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(20) API Story : Resources

  • "Resting places" for your API
  • Typically organized as HOME, COLLECTION, ITEM
  • Each resource is a 'state'
  • States return both properites and actions


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(21) API Story : Resources : Example



API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(22) API Story : Actions

  • The things clients can *do* at each resource
  • CRUD actions
  • Filters
  • Custom Actions (e.g. markComplete)


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(23) API Story : Actions : Example



API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(24) API Story : Rules

  • Limits on some actions
  • Usually implemented behind the interface
  • Examples:
  • ID must be unique
  • Customers cannot have duplicate accounts


API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(25) API Story : Rules : Example



API Stories Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(26) API Story : Summary

  • Structured markdown
  • Purpose, Properties, Resources, Actions, Rules
  • Design guidance, shared understanding

Excercise Mike Amundsen: Designing APIs with API Story Documents

(28) API Stories Exercise

  • Create an API Story Document
  • Complete sections
    • Purpose (single statement)
    • Properties (data points)
    • Resources (home, collection, item)
    • Actions (list, readItem, add, editItem, removeItem)
    • Rules (optional)
